                                            By

                                            By

                                            By 
Jack Shafer


                Chris Christie, speaks during a meet and greet with local residents in Bettendorf, Iowa. | AP Photo

            By 
Alex Isenstadt

11/12/15 03:59 PM EST
Chris Christie is making his first major foray into Iowa, with his super PAC launching a slate of radio advertisements in the state promoting him as “a true conservative outsider.”
It’s the first time that a pro-Christie group has purchased airtime in Iowa. The New Jersey governor has made New Hampshire the focus of his campaign, and the super PAC, America Leads, has spent the vast majority of its budget on running ads there.
Story Continued Below
The Iowa ad, which will begin running on Friday, highlights Christie’s record battling Democrats in his liberal home state. It will run for two weeks and on about a dozen radio stations. It comes as Christie is in the middle of a three-day campaign swing in the state.
“With Democrats fighting Chris Christie’s every move he did what others only talk about,” says the spot, which notes his vetoes of tax increases and his high-profile battles with teachers unions. “You want a president with the guts to stop the liberals ruining America, who cares about you and has your back?”
A spokesman for the super PAC, Tucker Martin, declined to say how much was being spent but called the sum “substantial.”
The decision to invest in Iowa comes as some in the party are calling for early-state polling to determine entry to future debates. At issue is whether debate hosts should base entry on a candidate’s standing in early-state polls, as opposed to the national ones that have been used so far. Christie, who polls at around 2 percent nationally, narrowly missed the cut to qualify for this week’s prime-time debate in Milwaukee.
CNN, which is hosting the next Republican debate, to be held Dec. 15 in Las Vegas, has yet to say whether it will be using early-state or national polls in deciding which candidates are allowed onstage.
 © 2015 POLITICO LLC
title: Chris Christie super PAC preps big ad run in Iowa
